intro: Verticordia spicata subsp. squamosa, commonly known as the squamosa malleolus, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, glandular, and often hairy foliage. The plant produces striking, pink to red flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators. It is typically found in sandy or gravelly soils in coastal and inland regions. Due to its unique appearance and habitat specificity, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
